Source   Edit  

The following CT and RT variables decide if we escape LaTeX snippets for the user. RT overrides possible CT setting. Default is we do not.The TeX compiler to use. For now if you wish to change it just adjust the global variable here.

Imports

types, backendCairo

Vars

TexCompiler = "lualatex"
Source   Edit  

Lets

ToEscape = EscapeLaTeXEnv
Source   Edit

    ...raises: [ValueError, OSError, IOError], tags: [WriteIOEffect, ReadIOEffect],
    forbids: [].}
Checks the of the given argument if formatted by LaTeX XXX: We should really implement some character escaping, because in particular % can break our TeX Daemon logic, because it might cause a } to be eaten! -> Implemented in basic way, but currently opt in! Source   Edit

proc drawBackground(img: var BImage[TikZBackend]; style: Style) {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
TikZ specific helper to draw the background. This is simply because LaTeX may extend the size of the page over our initial restriction if an element overflows. Therefore use use xcolor to set the page color explicitly. Source   Edit
